english_requirements.IELTS: 4.5 overall with min. 4.0 in each component

course_content.core:
The programme covers a range of topics including:

Academic English Academic English Writing in a structured way Academic writing for essays Academic writing for exams Reading academic texts Reading academic journals Conversing confidently Speaking with clarity Participating in group discussions Making a presentation Participating in seminars Developing your listening skills Listening for lectures Listening for discussion Study Skills Problem-solving Conducting independent research Fact-finding Evaluating arguments Critical thinking Proposing solutions E-learning skills Accessing online resources Digital literacy Effective note-taking Independent study

entry_requirements_raw.Foundation: [MUFY] Overall average 65% or above (Mathematics module is expected).
entry_requirements_raw.CPU: Successful completion of Grade 12 OSSD with a transcript prescribing a minimum of 75% subject average over 6 subjects and Mathematics is expected..
entry_requirements_raw.IB Diploma: Overall 30 points; 5 in Standard Level (SL) or 6 in a Higher Level (HL) Mathematics module is expected..
entry_requirements_raw.SACE/WACE: ATAR 87 or above.  Grade A/B in Mathematics is expected at SPM,IGCSE, or an equivalent level qualification or higher.

course_content.core: Year 1 Introduction to Accounting Introduction to Business Management Information Introductory Securities and Markets Introductory Finance/Trading Simulation I Introductory Quantitative Techniques for Business and Finance Introduction to General Law Introduction to Business Law Year 2 Financial Accounting Further Management Accounting Financial Management Portfolio Management Assurance. Governance end Ethics. Plus 1 optional module Year 3 Work Placement Experience (12 months full-time work placement) Year 4 Advanced International Financial Reporting Business and Professional Ethics Derivative Securities Management of Risk Principles of Taxation Plus 1 optional module

course_content.core:
Year 1
Modules include: Year 1 Introductory Securities and Markets Introductory Finance/Trading Simulation Introductory Economics for Business and Finance Introductory Quantitative Techniques for Business and Finance Ethics in Investment Management Business in Practice: Accounting for Managers Year 2
Modules include: Year 2 Management Accounting Corporate Finance Portfolio Management Financial Modelling Marketing Essentials Building Competitiveness Advantage: Business Strategy and Operations Year 3
Core modules include: Year 3 Management of Risk Islamic Banking Practices Fintech and Cryptocurrencies Derivative Securities Strategy and International Business International Marketing

course_content.core:
Year 1 Legal Skills Tort Contract Public Law 1 Criminal Law Research and Writing Skills Year 2 Equity & Trusts Land Law Public Law 2 Plus 3 Elective modules from the following: Legal Writing Credit Research Project Alternative Dispute Resolution* Malaysian Legal System* Year 3 Foundation of EU Law Writing Credit Pro Bono and Professional Practice Elective modules forming 80 credits from the following: Company Law Commercial Law Dissertation Employment Law Environmental Law Evidence* Family Law International Children’s Rights International Human Rights Intellectual Property Law International Mooting Law Medical Law Research Writing Credit Writing Credit Pro Bono and Professional Practice Note:

1. All optional modules are subject to availability and change.

2.* - Additional modules offered only at UoRM.

CPU.text: Successful completion of Grade 12 OSSD with a transcript prescribing a minimum of 75% subject average over 6 subjects..

course_content.core:
Year 1
Core modules include: Year 1 General Introduction to Law Introduction to Property Law Introduction to Planning and Building Introductory Economics for Business and Finance Introduction to Data Analysis Investment Appraisal Projects in Real Estate and Planning (1) Year 2
Core modules include: Year 2 Applied Property Law Managing Change in Real Estate Sector Planning Law and Practice Projects in Real Estate and Planning (2) Property Valuation Real Estate Economics and Investment Year 3
Core modules include: Year 3 Applied Valuation Projects in Appraisal and Management Dissertation (optional) Development Appraisal and Finance Real Estate Asset Management Finance and Markets (optional) Investment Strategy and Management (optional)

course_content.core:
Year 1
Core modules include: Year 1 The Person and the Brain Learning about Learning Introduction to Psychological Research Debates in Mental Health Applied & Professional Psychology Psychology in the Workplace (with work placement) Year 2
Core modules include: Year 2 Cognitive and Biological Psychology Development Across the Lifespan Research Methods in Psychology Social Psychology and Individual Differences Professional and Clinical Practice (with work placement) Behaviour Change Optional modules include Alternative Dispute Resolution Behaviour Change Founder Dilemmas Year 3/Year 4
Core modules include: Year 3/Year 4 Research Project Communicating Current Psychology Practicum / Industrial Training Optional modules include Counselling: Theory and Practice Face Processing Forensic Psychology Psychology and Culture Visual Perception: Physiology, Psychophysics, and Psychology

course_content.core: Research Projects in the following areas: Real Estate, especially: Urban planning, town planning, placemaking (e.g., challenges of an ageing society). Smart cities and ESG factors (e.g., smart transportation systems and social inclusion). Property management and property investment (e.g., proptech startups, smart contract to facilitate property investment). Finance and Accounting, especially: Applied financial econometrics (e.g., AI techniques to develop predictive models for financial markets). Blockchain and cryptocurrency analysis (e.g., behaviour of blockchain-based markets and trading strategies). Green bonds (fixed-income security) (e.g., technology enabling green bond structures and environmental impacts). Carbon accounting and management (e.g., new carbon accounting methodologies). Entrepreneurship and innovation, especially: Social entrepreneurship (e.g., AI and social innovation, ethical considerations). Digital startups (e.g., “gain-of-function,” AGI alignment and safety). Disruption and innovation (e.g., new technologies and business models). New product development (e.g., IoT technologies, blockchain-based supply chain management). Supply chain management (SCM) (e.g., cybersecurity risks, innovation in SCM). Business analytics, especially: Decision support (e.g., new visualization methods to support decision-making processes). Big data analytics (e.g., flood mitigation and monitoring techniques). Predictive analytics (e.g., predictive models for marketing).

Masters.text: Master’s degree or an equivalent qualification recognised by the Malaysian Government, or other qualification that the University accepts..

Degree.text: A minimum upper second-class or international equivalent, or in exceptional circumstances, such as where a student has accrued significant relevant experience, a good 2.2 (lower second-class honours) degree..

course_content.core: Research Projects in the following areas: Counselling and Mental Health, especially: Use of mental health apps Forensic Psychology, especially: orensic Psychology, especially: Aversive personalities Offending and criminal behaviour Investigative interviewing Nutrition and Cognition, especially: Effects of food (nuts, supplements, fruits and vegetables) on cognition Executive functions Perception, especially: Face perception, including health-related judgements Self-face perception, atypical self-representation Judgement and decision-making Effects of nature scenes on cognition Social Psychology, especially: Social psychology of communication Social cognition, attitudes, culture Applied and critical social psychology Vision Science, especially: Vision and cognitive benefits Texture perception

Degree.text: A minimum upper second-class or international equivalent, or in exceptional circumstances, such as where a student has accrued significant relevant experience, a good 2.2 (lower second-class honours) degree..

Masters.text: Master’s degree or an equivalent qualification recognised by the Malaysian Government, or other qualification that the University accepts..
